This brilliantly designed app is a must for anyone with an engineering, physics, or just plain mechanical tinkering passion ... and a lot of dogged persistence! I just completed the app, demonstrating that every level, including those in the Portal Proficiency add-on, is solvable for both Drive and Convoy. Be prepared to think‚Äù outside the box‚Äù to get around some particularly nasty and seemingly impossible challenges. Tip: solve every level first for Drive, then go back and optimize each solution for the more demanding Convoy. Congratulations to the design team on a brilliantly conceived and expertly implemented app!
Make Portal 3 we are waiting !!!

I can only assume none of the people posting reviews have played polybridge. I really wanted to love this game, but the physics are absolute trash. Everything moves like it‚Äôs inside molasses and all the structures you can build are elastic, unrealistically stretching and squashing. The fact that they went with an extremely simple elastic physics simulation instead of actually simulating stress on hard bodies just goes to show how little effort was put into this game.

title.label: Great game, but a bug ruined it

content.label: I had a lot of fun with this game and I loved the portal theme and working with all the fun puzzles, but I opened the app one day and the game was acting like I‚Äôve never opened it before. Before I knew it I realized all my save data was deleted for no reason. I was really bummed but I still tried to get back to where I was and after a week or so the same thing happened. Has this happened to anyone else? Is there any way to recover data? I love this game but that just makes me not want to play it at all.

The first 30 levels are good fun. The issue I have are that physics cannot ever be repeated reliably. I would get one part of the challenge squared away such as getting a brick to a button. As soon as I started to set up things for the drivers, The previous portion I made would suddenly be allllllll wrong! Despite no changes what so ever being made to it‚Äôs structure. Waste of money to me.

Updated Review:
If there was only one thing I'd change it add to this game. It would be to please make the zooming in and out function work a little better place. I often have to spread apart my fingers multiple times on the screen or vice versa to zoom in or out on the gameplay. It's not terrible but it just doesn't seem to work as smoothly as I'd prefer and I have to do the gestures multiple times usually before I get the game to zoom in or out.

Still, despite that issue I'd highly recommend purchasing this game. I'm not far into it, asI mentioned below in my original review. But, I've had lots of fun so far regardless of my lack of progress. 

Thanks to the developer if you'll please consider making the zoom function a little smoother. And thanks, again, for this great game, God bless and Merry Christmas üòáüéÑüéÖüèª.

Original Review:
This is my first time playing a Bridge Constructor game. I have however played the Portal games many times before in all of their iterations. Even without having played Bridge Constructor before, though, I have to say that this mashup of both titles is just great I think.

I'm only about four levels in so far but I'm having such a fun time. I really enjoy the Portal humor and wit and building bridges is also tons of fun in my opinion. 

I also found that the tutorials you play through in the beginning were very well done and I feel like I'm picking up on how the game is played pretty well thus far, thanks.

After having played some of this game I believe I'll have to check out the other Bridge Constructor titles now. Thanks to everyone involved in creating Bridge Constructor Portal, I really like it a lot. And, I'm very grateful for all of the hard work and time no doubt put into this video game. Plus, it's just so nice to hear the snarky voice of GLaDOS again, haha. Her pithy and dry wit is always welcome and entertaining in my opinion.

Thanks, again, for this great game, God bless, Merry Christmas and Happy New Years.

I bought the game like 2 weeks ago and I played it for a while and then went camping for a week, and when I got back from the camping trip, all of my progress was reset and it seems like every time I leave the game for a day all my progress gets reset. Please help.

I played all the way to level 50, then took a break. When I booted the game, all my progress was gone. I enjoyed the game enough to start again, but not before I considered deleting it from my iPad. I‚Äôve also had problems with saving levels. I‚Äôm a sucker for all things Portal, but please, make your save functions more robust!
